thread.title: What are your biggest regrets?
thread.title_full: What are your biggest regrets? - Telegraph

author: Eleanor Doughty
title: What are your biggest regrets?
text: Je ne regrette rien , sang Edith Piaf famously in 1959. Well, lucky old Piaf – she’s one of the only ones. According to new research conducted by Homestay.com , the average Briton has three major lifetime regrets. Apparently we spend more than five minutes a day reflecting on them, too. The survey found that more than 70 per cent of over 60s said that they didn’t think it was possible to live a life of no regrets at all. Of the 2,000 people surveyed, these five things were the most significant regrets. Not travelling and seeing more of the world Photo: LeBlanc/Rex Not staying in touch with more friends Photo: Alamy Wasting years with the wrong partner Photo: Alamy Not working harder at school Photo: Alamy Not telling a relative who’s now dead, that I loved them Photo: Alamy The survey also wanted to know about the things that have made the over 60s feel most pleased about. The top five results, as revealed by Homestay.com are: Getting married Photo: Alamy Passing driving test Photo: Alamy Friendships Photo: Alamy Travelling and seeing the world Photo: Alamy Finishing university Photo: Alamy But tell us: which of these do you feel most pleased about? @telegoodlife
